DOC.HEAD: Moderate Quake Rolls Through Hollister Area
DOC.TEXT: A moderate earthquake struck the Hollister area Monday, but no damage or injuries were reported. The quake, at 9:07 a.m., measured 4.1 on the Richter scale and was centered in an area 13 miles south-southeast of Hollister, the U.S. Geological Survey in Menlo Park said. The Richter scale is a measure of ground motion as recorded on seismographs. Every increase of one number means a tenfold increase in the strength of the shaking. Thus, a reading of 7.5 reflects an earthquake 10 times stronger than one of 6.5. On Oct. 17, a major quake measuring 7.1 on the Richter scale struck Northern California, killing 67 people, injuring about 3,000 and causing $7 billion in damage. An earthquake of 3.5 on the Richter scale can cause slight damage in the local area, 4 moderate damage, 5 considerable damage, 6 severe damage.
